items.title: CARISTA
items.description: During the Gentse feesten I had a great time at Boomtown. I particularly liked the closing act of the free stage. Carista performed an amazing mix of genres that really got me moving. I really needed a good party and she delivered!

items.title: The two-minute rule
items.description: In David Allen’s Getting Things Done, you can find a simple, yet effective, rule against procrastination. Often, small things add up: at work, but also at home. Think of tiny tasks: send mom a message; clean your desk; responding to an email... We often put them off until the list of chores feels insurmountable. Allen’s rule is simple: if you can do it in less than two minutes, you should do it at the moment it’s defined. No more procrastination.

items.title: The Right Brain and the Unconscious
items.description:
![Book: The right brain and the unconcious](/assets/the-right-brain-and-the-unconscious.png "The right brain and the unconcious")

\
I don't read enough, but when I do, it needs to really motivate me to keep on reading. This book has quite possibly changed my way of thinking entirely on human behaviour and understanding much better how the right brain - or what most people refer to as the unconsciousness - works. It is a psychological and neurological journey through the brain, and explains many aspects of our growth and lives in great detail. You needn't any prior knowledge, yet this book manages to teach you A LOT about the brain and behavioural psychology. Thanks to this book I've managed to understand myself and my focus a lot better while playing difficult music on piano and violin.

items.title: Puella Magi Madoka Magica
items.description: Last week I watched this fantastic anime about magical girls on Netflix. Even though I am late to the party (since it’s an anime from 2011), I still want to recommend watching it. Without spoiling the story, there is more about the story than you would suspect from a cutesy magical girls series. Also, the soundtrack is amazing.

![Boardgame Everdell](/assets/everdell.png "Everdell")

This month I got this awesome board game from my girlfriend for my birthday.\
By finding unique and magical creatures you can build your own town. The game follows the seasons and after each season you got more workers to make your town even bigger. In the end, you should count all the points coupled with your town + coins you found on your path. I'm still learning to understand the small details of the game and of course the tactics.
